awd_titl_txt: Robust Feedback Control of Structures for Earthquake Hazard Mitigation
awd_abstract_narration: This project is to study robust control                                         strategies which are uncertainty tolerant.                                      The objective is to develop practical civil                                     structural control technology for seismic                                       resistant applications.                                                                                                                                         The project will consist of the following                                       tasks: (1) study of robust feedback loop                                        control design in the frequency domain, (2)                                     study of nonlinear design issues, (3) study                                     of control-structure interaction such as time                                   delays, and (4) experimental verification of                                    control strategies.                                                                                                                                             The research would contribute to the                                            development and implementation of robust                                        structural control strategies for earthquake                                    hazard mitigation.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF NOTRE DAME DU LAC
